lgp.core.evolution.instructions

Class Operation<T>

  • lgp.core.evolution.instructions.Operation<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Type of arguments that the operation operates on.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Module
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BinaryOperation, UnaryOperation

    public class Operation<T>
implements Module

    An operation has an enum Arity and some function that it can perform on class Arguments given to it.

    Operations are specified as interface Modules, meaning that custom operations can be implemented and use when generating instructions for an individual in the population.

    Operations should have some representation with them, so that the operation that they convey can be expressed in a textual form.

    See Also:
    enum Arity, class Arguments, interface Module

    • Constructor Detail

      • Operation

        public Operation(Arity arity,
                 kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super lgp.core.evolution.registers.Arguments<T>,? extends T> func)

        An operation has an enum Arity and some function that it can perform on class Arguments given to it.

        Operations are specified as interface Modules, meaning that custom operations can be implemented and use when generating instructions for an individual in the population.

        Operations should have some representation with them, so that the operation that they convey can be expressed in a textual form.

        Parameters:
        arity - How many arguments the operations function takes.
        func - A function mapping arguments to some value.
        See Also:
        enum Arity, class Arguments, interface Module

    • Method Detail

      • getRepresentation

        public java.lang.String getRepresentation()

        A way to express an operation in a textual format.

      • execute

        public T execute(Arguments<T> arguments)

        Executes an operation in some way. Generally this would simply involve applying the function the operation represents to the arguments given.

        Parameters:
        arguments - A set of arguments to the function.
        Returns:
        A value of type T mapped from the arguments.
